channel.title: ctf on Quentin
channel.description: Recent content in ctf on Quentin

item.title: TISC 2022 Level 5B - Palindrome's Secret
item.description: Palindrome’s Secret Challenge Description This was a Web challenge unlocked at level 5 that was part of the recent TISC 2022 CTF organised by CSIT. TISC 2022 was an individual CTF that is level-based and not exactly a typical jeopardy-style CTF, meaning that only 1 challenge is released at a time and only after you solve that 1 challenge do you unlock the next one. In this writeup, I will discuss my approach towards solving this particular web challenge.

item.title: TISC 2022 Level 4B - Cloudynekos

TISC 2022 was an individual CTF that is level-based and not exactly a typical jeopardy-style CTF, meaning that only 1 challenge is released at a time and only after you solve that 1 challenge do you unlock the next one. item.title: TISC 2022 Level 2 - Leaky Matrices

item.title: TISC 2022 Level 1 - Slay The Dragon
item.description: Slay the Dragon Challenge Description This was a pwn challenge and also the first challenge of the recent TISC 2022 CTF organised by CSIT. TISC 2022 was an individual CTF that is level-based and not exactly a typical jeopardy-style CTF, meaning that only 1 challenge is released at a time and only after you solve that 1 challenge do you unlock the next one. In this writeup, I will discuss my approach towards solving this particular pwn challenge.

item.title: SEETF 2022 Smart Contract DuperSuperSafe
item.description: DuperSuperSafe Challenge Description This was a smart-contract challenge that was part of the recent SEETF 2022 hosted by the Social Engineering Experts. I played this together under 3_Blind_Mice, a random team made together with @chuayupeng and ethon for pure fun and memes. Like all the other smart-contract challenges in this CTF, a vulnerable contract was deployed onto SEETF’s very own private blockchain network. Solving this challenge required knowing a concept in blockchain –> that private variables in a contract are technically public and still readable, and also understanding the difference between tx.

item.title: SEETF 2022 Smart Contract Challenge - RollsRoyce
item.description: RollsRoyce Challenge Description This was a smart-contract challenge that was part of the recent SEETF 2022 hosted by the Social Engineering Experts. I played this together under 3_Blind_Mice, a random team made together with @chuayupeng and ethon for pure fun and memes. Like all the other smart-contract challenges in this CTF, a vulnerable contract was deployed onto SEETF’s very own private blockchain network. Solving this challenge required exploiting 2 vulnerabilities, a pseudorandomness vulnerability that leveraged on block.
